actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to initiate actions under section 310 of the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to agricultural trade barriers, and to extend and initiate the triggered marketing loan program or an expanded export enhancement program, if an international trade agreement under the General Agreement on Tariff and Trade is not submitted to Congress by February 15, 1991, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Declares that if a draft bill implementing a certain agricultural agreement under the Uruguay round of negotiations under the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) is not submitted by the President to the Congress before February 15, 1991: (1) the United States Trade Representative shall submit, by May 31, 1991, an additional report required under the Trade Act of 1974 that identifies those countries that have major trade barriers to, and practices that distort, the export of U.S. agricultural products; and (2) the President shall instruct the Secretary of Agriculture to implement a marketing loan program or an export enhancement program in accordance with the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988. Amends the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 with respect to implementation of such marketing loan and export enhancement programs.

titles.title: A bill to initiate actions under section 310 of the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to agricultural trade barriers, and to extend and initiate the triggered marketing loan program or an expanded export enhancement program, if an international trade agreement under the General Agreement on Tariff and Trade is not submitted to Congress by February 15, 1991, and for other purposes.
